lines.text: [last lines]

You also asked me if I'm happy. That's a hard question to answer. The trouble with happiness is that you never know when you have it. You remember it. Ask me in another ten years. Maybe I'll be able to tell you.
[first lines]
What a great party!
Why do people go to parties?
To meet a partner.
Why do they want to do that?
To go to parties with.
Ladies and Gentlemen, Mr. and Mrs. Guy Jamieson will now dance "The Bridal Waltz".
Well, I'm not discounting the possibility, but I'd like to get to know you first.
I think you're taking a big risk there.
Why?
Well you might get to know me, and find out you don't like me and then you'll miss out on a fantastic root.
Shouldn't we find out if we any things in common?
So you think you've had sex, do you?

[to Guy]
We noticed Jenny's not here!
You're going straight from youth to old age and missing the middle bit.
What's the middle bit?
Yeah, I hate you too. As long as you haven't gone off me.
The magic's gone hasn't it? And we can't get it back.
Fong Hoo's parents are dead. Who wrote that letter?
Look I know you wrote to him, but his letter didn't arrive, so mum had to write it herself.
What?
Guy, she worked really hard on it.
Guy and I have a bit of an announcement to make.
We've decided to split up.
Lizzie, it's about time to cut the cake.
